alert.note: Alert for Panola; Quitman; Tate (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Memphis (Western Tennessee, Eastern Arkansas and Northern Mississippi)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 01 at 8:11AM CDT by NWS Memphis
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Tate, northeastern Quitman and Panola Counties through 845 AM CDT... At 811 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Curtis Station, or 13 miles west of Batesville, moving northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Batesville, Marks, Sardis, Crenshaw, Sledge, Curtis Station, Darling, Pleasant Grove, Falcon, Mims, Riverview, Longtown, Asa, Ballentine, Hinchcliff, Sarah, Locke Station, Essex, Horatio and Cypress Corner. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
